error.signature: Could not connect to Neptune endpoint: Connection timed out
error.regex: (Could not connect to Neptune|Neptune .+ connection (refused|timed out)|gremlin .+ WebSocket .+ failed)

verdict.summary: Client cannot connect to Neptune graph database due to VPC networking, security groups, or IAM auth issues.

dead_ends.action: Try to connect to Neptune from outside the VPC
dead_ends.why_fails: Neptune is VPC-only with no public endpoint; external access requires SSH tunneling or a VPN

dead_ends.action: Change Neptune instance class to fix connection issues
dead_ends.why_fails: Instance class affects performance, not network connectivity

workarounds.action: Ensure client is in the same VPC and security group allows port 8182
workarounds.how: Check security group allows inbound TCP on port 8182 from the client's security group or CIDR

workarounds.action: Use an EC2 instance or Lambda in the same VPC as a jump host for external access

leads_to.condition: Connection succeeds but IAM auth rejects the request
